questions.question: He ………………………. come yesterday.
questions.description: Use couldn't to talk about past inability.

questions.question: They …………………………. come in the evening.
questions.description: We do not use can in affirmative sentences to talk about possibility.

questions.question: She ……………………….. spend hours talking to herself.
questions.description: Use would to talk about past habits.

questions.question: When we were kids, we ………………………….. go swimming every weekend.
questions.description: Use would to talk about past habits.

questions.question: You ………………………… apologize for being rude to him.
If you have already applied, you …………………………… not apply again.
You …………………………. to exercise regularly.
questions.description: Ought is the only modal auxiliary followed by a to-infinitive.

questions.question: Glass ………………………….. be blown.
questions.description: Use can to talk about theoretical possibility.

questions.question: Chennai …………………………. be quite hot in summer.
questions.description: Use can to talk about properties typical of a person or thing.

questions.question: You …………………………… never throw away anything useful.
